title: Adaptive E-Learning and Virtual Patient Simulation-Based Language Assessment Training for Enhancing Early Cerebral Palsy Diagnostic Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience, understanding of language development stages, basic clinical observation skills
context.additional_context: A project-based assessment-centered education conducted in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment. A diagnostic competency enhancement program for language therapy vocational trainees, emphasizing the development of language evaluation and intervention planning skills through virtual patient simulations and real clinical case linkages.

learning_goals: Achieving over 80% proficiency in observing and documenting language development delays when using cerebral palsy prediction tools for infants under six months in virtual patient simulations.
Improving accuracy in applying language assessment protocols during clinical decision-making by over 75% using adaptive e-learning modules.
Evaluating the ability to apply diagnostic protocols and develop language intervention plans in simulation environments resembling real-world cases.

resources: Cerebral Palsy Prediction Assessment Tool Dataset

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
